relationships.notes: Her brother’s death and restoration anchor her posture of mourning and prophetic anointing, showing how family grief becomes the stage for her testimony to Jesus’s glory.
The sisters’ contrasting responses—Mary at Jesus’s feet listening while Martha serves, both lamenting Lazarus—highlight complementary modes of discipleship within the same household.

traits.posture_of_listening: Sits at the Lord’s feet listening to his word while Martha is distracted with much serving.
traits.commendation: Praised by Jesus for choosing the 'better part,' which will not be taken away from her, often interpreted as symbolizing contemplative discipleship.

traits.sister_of_lazarus: Appears as Lazarus’s sister who stays seated at home until Jesus calls for her, then falls at his feet weeping and repeating Martha’s lament that he had not been there.
traits.anointing_of_jesus: At a dinner in Bethany, anoints Jesus’s feet with costly perfume and wipes them with her hair, an act Jesus interprets in light of his burial.
traits.witness_to_sign: Participates in the family context of Lazarus’s raising, responding with deep emotion that leads Jesus himself to weep.
traits.narrative_profile: Embodies intense devotion, sorrow, and prophetic action, intimately associated with Jesus’s impending death and the revelation of his glory.
